action.name: Load Shot
entries: At initiative 20 the trebuchet loads either a boulder, gravel or fire shot.

action.name: Fire loaded Shot
entries: At initiative 10 the trebuchet fires the shot it loaded.

action.name: Boulder Shot
entries: Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.

action.name: Gravel Shot
entries: Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and starts {@condition bleeding|GuildWars} for the duration, taking {@damage 2d4} damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.

action.name: Fire Shot
entries: Choose a point that you can see within range. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage and starts {@condition burning|GuildWars} for the duration, taking {@damage 4d4} damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.

action.name: Reset
entries: At initiative 0 the trebuchet resets.

trait.name: Damage Threshold
entries: The trebuchet only takes damage if it took at least 10.

trait.name: Requires operation
entries: At least two creatures must use their action to operate the trebuchet for it to be able to load, fire and reset.
A trebuchet, a siege weapon similar to a catapult or ballista, is a stationary map object used to inflict large amounts of damage to those in its target zone.

trait.name: Arcane Barrier
entries: While channeling an Obelisk, the Mage has an AC of 15, 100 hit points and a damage threshold of 10.

trait.name: Channeling
entries: While channeling an Obelisk, the Mage's STR, DEX and CON score get replaced by the Obelisks.

action.name: Obelisk Lightning
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Discharge Arcane Lightning
entries: When a hostile creature enters the Mage's reach or start's its turn in range, the mage can use its Obelisk Lightning attack as a reaction.

bonus.name: Obelisk Lightning
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) lightning damage.
An Obelisk is a magical attack platform usually constructed with three upright pillars surrounding a central raised dais.

action.name: Cat's Claws
entries: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength/Dexterity modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

action.name: Flame Scepter
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) fire damage.

Bonfaaz Burntfur is a powerful Charr chieftain and the leader of the Charr forces assaulting Ascalon. Players first encounter him in The Great Northern Wall mission as he prepares the Charr forces for an invasion of the areas of Ascalon south of the wall. Later on they encounter him in the Nolani Academy mission as he tried to capture the capital city of Rin.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Bonfaaz Burntfur is an 18th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19}, +11 to hit with spell attacks). Bonfaaz Burntfur has the following Elementalist (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: *Bonfaaz Burntfur casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Bonfaaz Burntfur fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Bonfaaz Burntfur moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Bonfaaz Burntfur casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Overcharge Effigy (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Bonfaaz Burntfur chooses a titan effigy he can see and overcharges it, inspiring all charr within 60-feet of it. Each charr affected has advantage on their next attack roll, has their movement speed doubled for 1 round, and gains one additional action.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its Pike and one with its hooves or two with its Longbow.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

The Modniir is a pride of Centaurs that live in regions of the Shiverpeak Mountains, such as Drakkar Lake, Norrhart Domains, and Varajar Fells. Modniir are usually seen hunting in small groups consisting of three or four, but can occasionally be seen in large groups.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: They have advantage on saving throws against poison, and they have resistance to poison damage.

One of the oldest races on Tyria, the Dwarves are humanoids that are stocky, short, and are almost always bearded. The dwarves live in the Shiverpeak Mountains - specifically the Northern Shiverpeaks and the Southern Shiverpeaks.

In recent years, the dwarves have been plunged into a civil war between the older Deldrimor dwarves and the recent Stone Summit faction. This war has caused unrest throughout the Shiverpeaks and hold up most travel between Ascalon and the other human nations.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience

Deldrimor is a kingdom of dwarves residing in the Shiverpeak Mountains. They are very friendly towards other races, such as the humans, and passage through the harsh mountain range (which, along with the Sea of Sorrows divides the continent of Tyria in half) is welcome to anyone who is a friend of Deldrimor.

reaction.name: Invoke the Great Dwarf

entries: The Dryder has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}, and magic can't put the Dryder to sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb

trait.name: Web Walker

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4+4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.
Dryders are spider-like creatures that can be found throughout Tyria and the Mists.

They are almost exclusively offensive spellcasters, mostly encountered as hex-based necromancers throughout Tyria, and more frequently as elementalists and mesmers in The Mists, where they usually serve Dhuum.
They tend to prefer very cold or icy places, such as the Shiverpeaks mountains, or on the contrary extremely hot places, such as the Ring of Fire Islands.
They also seem to feed on souls as they are frequently seen next to dead bodies or souls, and their skills (Soul Leech, Soul Torture) further references that.
According to Nicholas the Traveler, Frostfire Dryders have poisonous fangs, however none of the Dryders in the game can actually inflict poison.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The ice elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Splinter
entries: A creature that hits the ice elemental with a melee weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage while within 5 feet of the elemental takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage as shards of ice fly out from the elemental's body.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Ice Golem makes two attacks: two with its Ice Claw, it can forgo one of these attacks to cast a spell.

action.name: Ice Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Encase in Ice
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, ice begins to form around the creature, and it is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} in ice on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature spends at least 1 hour in a warm environment. Alternatively, a creature can be freed of the {@condition restrained} or {@condition petrified} conditions if it takes at least 10 fire damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Tribal Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

An old folk legend states the only reason Dolyaks were domesticated instead of minotaurs is because minotaurs would rather be beaten to death than obey a command. Dolyaks, simply put, were less stubborn. Minotaurs are one of the oldest species in Tyria and are very much prized by the Norn for their warm, furry coats. They were once extremely populous throughout the Shiverpeaks but now reside solely in the northern regions, where they have sheltered valleys and caves to make their homes.

Juniper Barks are plant creatures that populate the Shiverpeak Mountains. They spend most of their time just below the surface of the ground, but pop up to attack when enemies come near. While not particularly dangerous by themselves, when they appear during a battle with other, more dangerous creatures, they cease to be a mere nuisance and become a true threat.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d4 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The imp magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the imp wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.
Maak Frostfriend is an Ice Imp boss in the Shiverpeaks.
Skitt Skizzle is an Ice Imp boss that appears in the Ice Floe.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ice Imp Elementalist Boss is a 10th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The Ice Imp Elementalist Boss has the following Elementalist (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The Ice Imp Boss casts these spells on itself before combat.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Ice Imp Boss moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ice Imp Boss uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Ice Imp Boss attacks using one of it attacks.

legendary.name: Invisibility
entries: The Ice Imp Boss uses Invisibility.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The imp can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a rat (speed 20 ft.), a raven (20 ft., fly 60 ft.), or a spider (20 ft., climb 20 ft.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the imp's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The imp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the ice imp boss fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Ice Imp Boss makes two attacks: two with its sting, it can forgo one of these attacks to cast a spell or use Invisibility.

action.name: Sting (Bite in Beast Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d4 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Gambol Headrainer is an Ice Imp boss that appears in the Ice Floe.
Sniik Hungrymind is an Ice Imp boss that can be found in the Southern Shiverpeaks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

legendary.name: Invisibility

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: They have advantage on saving throws against poison, and they have resistance to poison damage.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The stone summit beastmaster deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Mount and Rider
entries: The Stone Summit Beastmaster is a combination of a mount and a rider, while mounted they share all statistics. If the rider is forced to dismount, treat them as a commoner and the mount acts according to its alignment.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the stone summit beastmaster boss fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
Ore Darkwhip is a warrior dwarf boss in Iron Horse Mine that you need to kill in order to obtain War Machine Plans to complete the quest Minaar's Worry.
Thorgrim Beastlasher is the leader of the Stone Summit beastmasters.

reaction.name: Invoke the Great Destroyer
entries: Once per day the stone summit dwarf can cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke} at 3rd level using this ability.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Stone Summit Beastmaster makes two attacks: one with its stomp and one with its swipe, it can forgo one of these attacks to cast a spell or use its giant stomp.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Giant Stomp {@recharge}
entries: Target each creature other than you within 150-feet of you. Each target must make a Strength saving throw ({@dc 18}). On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

footerEntries: *The Stone Summit Beastmaster casts these spells on itself before combat.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Stone Summit Beastmaster Boss moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)

trait.name: Dwarven Fleet Foot
entries: When Minaar Stonesledge takes fire damage, her speed increases by 10 feet until the end of her next turn. In addition, she has advantage on her initiative.

trait.name: Siege Expert
entries: Minaar Stonesledge deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Minaar Stonesledge makes two Wrecking Maul or Fire Blast attacks.

action.name: Wrecking Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from Minaar Stonesledge and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fire Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) fire damage.

action.name: Combustion Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: Minaar Stonesledge slams her massive hammer into the ground, battering herself and its foes with a fiery shockwave. Each creature within 20 feet of Minaar Stonesledge, including herself, must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures behind cover have advantage on the saving throw.

action.name: Thunder Bomb
entries: Minaar Stonesledge lights a grapefruit-sized bomb and throws it at a point up to 60 feet away, where it explodes. Each creature within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After Minaar Stonesledge throws the bomb, roll a {@dice d6}; on a roll of 4 or lower, Minaar Stonesledge has no more bombs to throw.

action.name: Thunder Bomb (Enhanced)
entries: Minaar Stonesledge lights a grapefruit-sized bomb and throws it at a point up to 60 feet away, where it explodes. Each creature within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After Minaar Stonesledge throws the bomb, roll a {@dice d6}; on a roll of 4 or lower, Minaar Stonesledge has no more bombs to throw.

Minaar Stonesledge is a Deldrimor dwarf who has been captured by the Stone Summit and put to work in the Iron Horse Mine. While in captivity, he has heard about some Stone Summit plans for a new war machine, which become the focus of the quest Minaar's Worry.

reaction.name: Invoke the Great Dwarf.
entries: Once per day, if Minaar Stonesledge fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: King Jalis Ironhammer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: King Jalis Ironhammer can reroll a saving throw that he fails. He must use the new roll.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, King Jalis Ironhammer can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Extra Damage
entries: If King Jalis Ironhammer has more than half his hit points remaining, he deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage on every hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The King Jalis Ironhammer makes three attacks: three with its Greataxe, he can forgo one of these attacks to cast a spell.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

The wise king of the Deldrimor dwarves, King Jalis Ironhammer rules his people from the peaks of the Shiverpeak mountains. He is a smart, strong, patient man who makes decisions based solely on how they will affect the well-being of all the dwarves in Deldrimor. He lives to serve his people, and they love and respect him for it.

There are those, however, who wish to see the good king taken out of power. Namely, the Stone Summit, a group of xenophobic dwarves who had broken their ties with Deldrimor and are trying to take control of the dwarven nation. Over the past several years, the Summit have been growing their power, and a civil war is brewing.

King Jalis Ironhammer does not want to fight other dwarves, but he will do what he must to keep his people safe. Along with his loyal brother, Brechnar Ironhammer, the king has rallied his forces, and they stand ready to defend their home. The question on the king's mind though is this: Can he win?

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: King Jalis Ironhammer is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Strength (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). King Jalis Ironhammer has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: *King Jalis Ironhammer casts these spells on himself before combat.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the Volatile Ice Elemental, it explodes in a burst of jagged ice. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 2d4}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Volatile Ice Elemental remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

action.name: Explode
entries: The Volatile Ice Elemental explodes, killing itself and empowering its Death Burst trait:
- The DC increases to {@dc 14}.
- The radius increases to 10 feet.
- The damage increases to 8 ({@damage 4d4}) cold damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Nicholas the Traveler is a 5th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). Nicholas the Traveler has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The urban ranger makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.
Nicholas Sandford (born 1035 AE) is an Ascalonian traveler, a craftsman and a writer.

Nicholas met his dolyak friend, Professor Yakkington, during a snowstorm in the Northern Shiverpeaks. The two managed to survive by huddling together for warmth and they have been together ever since.

Due to the Searing, Nicholas lost his parents, friends and beloved Mary Malone. After having mourned in seclusion for years, his hair grown white, he started to travel the world and dropped his last name in favor of the moniker "the Traveler".
He has made many friends, including Gwen and Durmand, and is often seen collecting items to aid them (especially Durmand or Zinn) in some form, or catering to Yakkington's whims.

A true craftsman, Nicholas is able to make various tools and even small sculptures out of various items he finds. Once he helped Vael by making a disguise out of Quetzal Crests so Vael could spy on the Tengu of Cantha.
In exchange, he has gathered up a hefty supply of exotic and unique items to put in his Gifts of the Traveler, which he trades with adventurers in exchange for the items he needs.
Nicholas is very interested in local folklore, in fauna and flora. As a writer he has written a novel entitled "There with Yakkington: A Traveler's Tale.".

He also claims to be a gourmet chef, thanks to the various different foods he has tasted throughout his travels, which his friendship with Imperial Chef Yileng may suggest to be true, and a medic, as he is often seen trying to come up with some remedy to counteract various poisons (notably those inflicted by Dryders or Rot Wallows).

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the yak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 6d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

Professor Yakkington (born in 1057 AE) is the companion of Nicholas Sandford the Traveler. He was found by Nicholas during a blizzard in Traveler's Vale, having been abandoned by his mother like most young Dolyaks perceived to be weak. After using each other for warmth in the blizzard, Yakkington has joined Nicholas in his travels across Tyria.

In their travels, Yakkington is the fighter of the pair, holding back the wildlife for Nick. He also has a good sense of smell which comes in handy when trying to find their path again should they get lost.

Since his travels, Yakkington has become pampered by Nicholas, and often becomes stubborn. He enjoys having daily sweets and eating Red Iris Flowers, but has a strong fear of snakes and darkness. Because of his fears, Nick often puts Enchanted Lodestones to act as lights at night when Yakkington sleeps. According to Nick, he is 6'8", weighs about a ton, and his lucky number is 5.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When the knave makes an attack, they have advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knave makes two Morningstar or two Javelin attacks. They can replace one attack with a Shield Bash attack.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if the target is {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Stay Down
entries: The knave kicks one {@condition prone} creature within 5 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or their speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn.
Pitney was a farmer whose field was plagued by worms and resided in Ashford. After the Searing, he has joined the Ascalon Army wanting revenge on the Charr.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Overwhelming Revelation {@recharge 5}
entries: The diviner magically creates a burst of illumination in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of the diviner's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

reaction.name: Portent (3/Day)
entries: When the diviner or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the diviner rolls a {@dice d20} and chooses whether to use that roll in place of the {@dice d20} rolled for the attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.
Mother of Ivy the Rabbit Slayer  (Web view) and Ben  (Web view), wife of Sven  (Web view).
A part of a group that went north off the wall, the group she is a part of is still missing.
Have been missing for the last three months, were supposed to be back four months ago.
Hope is that they had to take a longer route back.  Fear is that they are dead or captured.

entries: The ursan transformation has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Ursan Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ursan Rage {@recharge 5}
entries: Choose one creature that you can see within 5-feet of you. Target each creature other than you in a 5-foot-radius centered on the target. Make a melee attack against each target. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 3d6 + 4} slashing damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target is knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Ursan Force {@recharge 4}
entries: For 3 rounds, your speed is increased by 10 feet, and you cannot be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Ursan Roar {@recharge}
entries: Choose any number of friendly creatures that can hear you and are within 150-feet of you. For 1 round, the next time a target hits with a weapon attack, they deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage.

Additionally, choose any number of hostile creatures that can hear you and are within 150-feet of you. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target is {@condition weakness|GuildWars|weakened} for 1 round.

As the Spirit of ferocity and confidence and the natural embodiment of all bears, Bear is the most revered of all the Spirits of the Wild and is said to be an icon of strength, insight, and wisdom. According to ancient myths, she bestowed the norn with the totem ability to Become the Bear. The norn view Bear as both a Mother who protects her cubs and a Sister who helps people find their inner strength. She is said to give norn the power to face all odds, but some norn are aware that she can also strike with surprising speed. Because of the ursine appearance of the kodan, some norn believe that the kodan are blessed by Bear. Some followers of Bear claim that she has appeared in their dreams to give them guidance.

As the Spirit of ferocity and confidence and the natural embodiment of all bears, Bear is the most revered of all the Spirits of the Wild and is said to be an icon of strength, insight, and wisdom. According to ancient myths, she bestowed the norn with the totem ability to Become the Bear. The norn view Bear as both a Mother who protects her cubs and a Sister who helps people find their inner strength. She is said to give norn the power to face all odds, but some norn are aware that she can also strike with surprising speed. Because of the ursine appearance of the kodan, some norn believe that the kodan are blessed by Bear. Some followers of Bear claim that she has appeared in their dreams to give them guidance.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bone fiend makes a number of Spike attacks equal to half the level of the spell (rounded down) (minimum 1).

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk} your spell attack modifier to hit, range 80/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3} + Spell Level) piercing damage.
Bone Horrors are minions created by certain Necromancer skills (Animate Bone Horror, Malign Intervention, and Aura of the Lich) and the Minion Apocalypse Flux.
The Prize Moa Bird belonged to Pitney, before it disappeared deep into The Catacombs.

action.name: Impress
entries: Madam Featherbutt puts on a show for a spectral penal of judges. She does a performance check, and depending on the result, gains one of the following benefits:
1-10: Not impressed! — Madam Featherbutt has disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of her turn.
11-20: Impressive! — Madam Featherbutt has advantage on all saving throws until the end of her turn.
21+: Truly Magnanimous! — Madam Featherbutt has done such a good job impressing the judges that she gains plot armor and is immune to all damage and conditions until the DM decides otherwise.

reaction.name: "Not my prized Moa bird!"
entries: Madam Featherbutt can choose not to take damage from any source.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Madam Featherbutt doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when she flies out of an enemy's reach.

legendary.name: Flutter
entries: Madam Featherbutt moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of his turns, Rornark Stonesledge can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Rornark Stonesledge can deal an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Rornark Stonesledge that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Rornark Stonesledge doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rornark Stonesledge makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

Rornak Stonesledge is a Deldrimor spy who is frequently captured by enemy forces. He can be encountered during three missions in the Shiverpeaks, and in each case when freed by the player he initiates the mission's bonus objective.

He can first be encountered in Borlis Pass after having been caught by the Stone Summit forces in Maladar's Fort, where he learned of a plan to unleash an Ice Drake on Grooble's Gulch. When he is freed, he beseeches the player character to find and kill the Ice Drake. He is soon captured again on the path to the Frost Gate while trying to steal the Stone Summit's Secret Siege Weapon Plans. He is left in a dryder cave, and when rescued he enlists the player character's help to steal the plans, and repairs a Stone Summit ballista to blast open the gate protecting them.

He can be found a third time, much later, in the Ice Caves of Sorrow, this time a prisoner of the Mursaat after he was caught scouting for an alternative way into the White Mantle prison camp. When he is freed once more, he asks that Hamdor Grandaxe's rescue party be told where he is.

reaction.name: Invoke the Great Dwarf
entries: Once per day, if Rornark Stonesledge fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

As the Spirit of knowledge and foresight and the natural embodiment of ravens, Raven is said to be a trickster who is fond of riddles and wordplay and likes to test the wits of his followers and anyone else who wishes to uncover his secrets. He calls his followers fledglings, inspires artists, and also favors acts of kindness towards ravens who are viewed as his flock. In some cases Raven is believed to personally come to take the life of a norn who was about to die and guide the soul to the Mists.

The norn believe that Raven sees and knows all, and requires nothing but the petitioner's promise to always seek wisdom to grant them his blessing of swiftness. He only views someone unworthy in his eyes if the person does not learn from their mistakes, and he rewards the clever, the sincere, and those who seek out new experiences such as traveling the world.Although Raven represents the facets of mind that grant beings the vision to see and the wisdom to understand, his teachings also contain a darker side.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The corvid transformation has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing or smell.

action.name: Raven Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage. On hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition crippled|GuildWars} and start {@condition bleeding|GuildWars}, taking {@damage 1d4} damage, for 1 minute.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw for each condition affecting it. On a success, that condition ends.

action.name: Raven Swoop {@recharge 5}
entries: Choose one creature that you can see within 5-feet of you. Target each creature other than you in a 5-foot-radius centered on the target. Make a melee attack against each target. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 4d4 + 5} slashing damage.

bonus.name: Raven Flight {@recharge 4}
entries: For 1 round, you gain a flying speed of 30 feet, and you cannot be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Raven Shriek {@recharge}
entries: Choose any number of friendly creatures that can hear you and are within 150-feet of you. End the {@condition blinded} condition on each target.

Additionally, choose any number of hostile creatures that can hear you and are within 150-feet of you. Each target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a target is {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

As the natural embodiment of all owls, Owl was revered as one of the Spirits of the Wild among the norn. Although she was a gentle Spirit who embodied home and hearth, she was also a silent and clever predator with ambush-like swiftness and precision. Helping the sick and wounded pleased her. Owl put her family's needs and safety above all else, often teaching others that the purpose of the hunt was not just to kill but also to provide and protect. Tales about Owl depict her offering her wisdom to both norn and her fellow Spirits of the Wild.

As the Spirit of teamwork, friendship, family, and the natural embodiment of all wolves, Wolf is said to be dedicated to brotherhood as he imparts the virtues of loyalty, ferocity, and strength in numbers. He is revered as a masculine spirit, and the norn call him their brother, son, father, and uncle when they ask for his blessing. According to old tales, Owl taught Wolf how his hunting would be for naught if his family dined alone, making Wolf heed Owl's wisdom as he returned to his cubs. Although in some cases Raven was believed to personally come to take the life of a norn who was about to die and guide the soul to the Mists, Wolf was also known to do the same to people who walked in his footsteps.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The volfen transformation has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The volfen transformation has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the volfen transformation's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Volfen Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) damage. On hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain a {@condition deep wound|GuildWars} for 2 rounds.
At the end of each of its turns, a target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the condition ends.

bonus.name: Volfen Agility {@recharge 4}
entries: For 1 round, increase the range in which your recharge abilities recharge by 1.

bonus.name: Volfen Pounce {@recharge 5}
entries: For 1 round, your speed is increased by 20% and the next time you hit with an attack, it deals an additional {@damage 1d12} damage in a 5-foot radius around the attack target, ignoring you.

bonus.name: Volfen Bloodlust {@recharge}
entries: Choose any number of friendly creatures that can hear you and are within 150-feet of you. For 1 round, each target can attack one additional time when they take the attack action on their turn.

headerEntries: The Incomplete Dragon Skeleton is an 11th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The Incomplete Dragon Skeleton has the following Warlock spells prepared:

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Incomplete Dragon Skeleton attacks using one of their attacks.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Incomplete Dragon Skeleton moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Incomplete Dragon Skeleton uses Spellcasting.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: They have advantage on saving throws against poison, and they have resistance to poison damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the stone summit sage boss fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
Saris Headstaver is a Stone Summit boss that appears in the Borlis Pass mission and Traveler's Vale.

reaction.name: Invoke the Great Destroyer
entries: Once per day the stone summit dwarf can cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke} at 3rd level using this ability.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

footerEntries: *The Stone Summit Conjurer casts these spells on itself before combat.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Stone Summit Conjurer moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Stone Summit Conjurer uses Spellcasting.

monster.name: Wraith
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Create Specter
entries: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a {@creature specter} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The {@creature specter} is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.
Wraiths are undead mesmers found in Kryta.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Wraith is an 8th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The Wraith has the following Mesmer (GW) spells prepared:

monster.name: Smoke Phantom
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Smoke Phantom can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Static Shock
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) lightning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.
Smoke Phantoms are the Elementalist of the Undead army, they can be annoying for low armor groups due to their Chain Lightning spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Smoke Phantom is an 8th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The Smoke Phantom has the following Elementalist (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The Smoke Phantom casts this spell on themselves before combat.
**The Smoke Phantom casts this spell on an ally before combat.

trait.name: False Appearance (Treant)
entries: While the Oakheart (Kryta) remains motionless, it appears as a great oak.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Oakheart (Kryta) deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Oakheart (Kryta) makes two slam or Rock attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
entries: The Oakheart (Kryta) magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of him. These trees have the same statistics as the Oakheart (Kryta), except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Rock action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the Oakheart (Kryta). The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the Oakheart (Kryta) dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the Oakheart (Kryta) takes a bonus action to turn them back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.
Oakhearts are sturdy plants found in Kryta.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

footerEntries: *The Oakheart (Kryta) casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The Large Spined Aloe has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Large Spined Aloe regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of The Large Spined Aloe's next turn. The Large Spined Aloe dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Throw Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.
Large Spined Aloe are plants that are usually buried near Oakhearts. They are always buried and popup when approached.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the reed stalker is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the reed stalker instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The reed stalker has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: False Appearance (Reed Stalker)
entries: While the reed stalker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal reed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Reed Stalker is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The Reed Stalker has the following Mesmer (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: **The Reed Stalker casts these spells on an ally before combat.

bonus.name: Hide
entries: The reed stalker takes the hide action.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Fling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

Reed Stalkers are violent plant creatures that inhabit the swamps and marshes of Kryta. They attack in numbers, but the real danger comes from their mesmer skills, which make them dangerous to attack, and equally dangerous to ignore.
Binding Ritual. Create a level 1...10...12 spirit who dies after 30...126...150 seconds. Attacks by that spirit steal up to 5...21...25 Health.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Spirit of Bloodsong makes a number of bloodsong attacks equal to half the level of the spell (rounded down, minimum 1).

action.name: Bloodsong
entries: {@atk rs} your spell attack modifier to hit, range 90/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + Spell Level}) necrotic damage, the Spirit of Bloodsong regains health equal to the damage dealt.

monster.name: Hell Hound
languages: understands Infernal but can't speak it

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The hound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Necrotic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The hound exhales necrotic energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hellhounds are undead creatures that are usually accompanied by a handler, like an Executioner or a Hellhound Keeper. Though they may appear like standard undead, they are actually constructs, much like a necromancer's minion.

action.name: Shortbow

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the Executioner to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the Executioner drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.
Executioners are large, hammer-wielding undead warriors often accompanied by hellhounds.

action.name: Crippling Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage. On a hit the target is  {@condition crippled} for 2 rounds.

action.name: Nibble
entries: Touch one dead creature, which has not been dead for more than 5 minutes and which has not been exploited by a spell. You regain hit points equal to {@dice 2d6 + 4}.

headerEntries: The Grasping Ghoul is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The Grasping Ghoul has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

entries: Grasping Ghouls are undead infantry that can often be found escorting Zombie Warlocks (either above ground or below - in the latter case, they will often popup out of the ground when players venture near them).

monster.name: Damned Cleric

entries: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turn Resistance

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries: The lich casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the lich's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet of the lich must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Vizier Khilbron is the last known survivor of Orr following the Cataclysm, and the ex-advisor to King Reza of Orr. He is responsible for the Cataclysm after reading a dark incantation from the Lost Scrolls, defeating the Charr army at the gates of Arah, but, in turn, destroying the entire kingdom.

Evennia of the Shining Blade makes a deal with him that, in return for the Scepter of Orr, he will lend his aid to the conflict between them and the White Mantle and the Unseen Ones. In 1072 AE, late into the Season of the Scion, he tricks the players into opening the Door of Komalie at the Ring of Fire Island Chain, setting free the Titans which he then controls using the scepter, and reveals his second, new identity. The Cataclysm did not spare him, but instead transformed him into the Undead Lich.
While in his Undead Lich form, he is defeated by the players while standing atop the bloodstone in front of the Door of Komalie.

The Vizier's decision to read from the Lost Scrolls to defeat the invading Charr has been seen as noble by some and deranged by others. Scholars debate whether a Charr victory in Orr would have been preferable to the nation's complete destruction, or that, under the circumstances, the Vizier could have made no other decision, and that the outcome of the spell could not have been foreseen.

It is revealed in the Realm of Torment that Terick, an Orrian citizen (who was in reality Razakel, a demonic agent of Abaddon) had convinced Khilbron into using the dark magic that caused the Cataclysm. The specter of Jutu later reveals that Khilbron was not simply coerced into using the magic but had also been converted to the worship of Abaddon prior to the Cataclysm.

The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

Verata is the first Necromancer Profession quest giver in pre-Searing Ascalon. After the Searing, he continued his research on undead minions, but his eager desire for knowledge caused him to use forbidden practices to increase the speed of his research. Because of this, he became an outcast of "the Order" and formed his own guild.

entries: The Wraith Mesmer Boss uses Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell disguise self} and {@spell invisibility} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Magi Malaquire is an eccentric old wizard found in Lion's Arch. He instructs Prophecies characters how to use the Signet of Capture through various quests. Afterwards, players may also buy Signets of Capture and any skills previously unlocked from him.

monster.name: Bone Dragon
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bone Dragon makes two attacks: two with its bite or two with its Bone Spike, it can forgo one of these attacks to cast a spell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bone Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120/360 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The Bone Dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Shard Breath.
items.entry: The Bone Dragon exhales a 15-foot cone of bone shards. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 26 ({@damage 6d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Noxious Breath.
items.entry: The Bone Dragon exhales a 15-foot cone of gas. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on itself on a success.

entries: Bone Dragons are found throughout the Kryta region in the Prophecies campaign. Bone Dragons as we see them are only half of their original bodies, the lower half having torn off due to the pure strength of the Bone Dragons' forearms when they were risen from their graves.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Bone Dragon is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The Bone Dragon has the following Ranger (GW) spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The White Mantle Necromancer Boss is a 10th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The White Mantle Necromancer Boss has the following Necromancer (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The white mantle necromancer boss has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the white mantle necromancer boss fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The White Mantle Necromancer Boss attacks using one of their attacks.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The White Mantle Necromancer Boss moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The White Mantle Necromancer Boss uses Spellcasting.
Bearn the Implacable is a White Mantle boss that appears in Riverside Province.
Brogan the Punisher is a White Mantle boss located in Twin Serpent Lakes.

Erulai the Inimical can be found on the Bloodstone during the mini-mission part of the All for One and One for Justice quest. He was once a friend of Olias, before Olias realized the truth of things and left.
Kenric the Believer is a White Mantle boss that is part of the expedition seeking to gain access to the Henge of Denravi ahead of the Shining Blade.
Oswald the Amiable is a White Mantle boss that may appear in Bloodstone Fen.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes three attacks, using Rapier or Pistol in any combination, they can forgo one of these attacks to cast a spell.

action.name: Rapier of Banishment
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the target succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma Saving Throw or be under the effect of the {@spell Banishment} until the end of their next turn, at which point they can attempt the Saving Throw again to reappear.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 30/90 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Captain's Charm
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 14}, one creature the pirate can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the start of the pirate's next turn.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: {@actTrigger} The pirate is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The pirate adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. On a miss, the pirate makes one Rapier attack against the triggering creature if within range.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Undead Captain Manzo is a 5th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Undead Captain Manzo has the following Warrior (GW) spells prepared:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the undead captain manzo fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the undead captain manzo to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the undead captain manzo drops to 1 hit point instead.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Undead Captain Manzo attacks using one of their attacks.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Undead Captain Manzo moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Undead Captain Manzo uses Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: First Mate Sakai is a 4th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Dexterity (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). First Mate Sakai has the following Ranger (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: **First Mate Sakai casts these spells before combat as a ritual.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the first mate sakai fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: First Mate Sakai makes two attacks: two with his Scimitar or two with his Longbow, he can forgo one of these attacks to cast a spell.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: First Mate Sakai attacks using one of his attacks.

legendary.name: Move
entries: First Mate Sakai moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: First Mate Sakai uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Load, Aim or Fire Cannon
entries: First Mate Sakai loads, aims or fires a cannon within 5-feet of him.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Musician Azume is a 9th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Musician Azume has the following Mesmer (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: *Musician Azume casts these spells on herself before combat.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the musician azume fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Musician Azume attacks using one of her attacks.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Musician Azume moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Musician Azume uses Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Akemi the Medic is an 8th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Akemi the Medic has the following Monk (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: **Akemi the Medic casts these spells on an ally before combat.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the akemi the medic fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Akemi the Medic moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Akemi the Medic uses Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Nai the Cook is an 11th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). Nai the Cook has the following Monk (GW) spells prepared:
footerEntries: *Nai the Cook casts these spells on himself before combat.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the nai the cook fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

legendary.name: Move

legendaryGroup.name: Bonfaaz Burntfur
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (winning initiative ties), Bonfaaz Burntfur can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; Bonfaaz Burntfur can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

- Choose three points that he can see, designating them for destruction. An ominous sound can be heard when standing within 10-feet of a designated point. At initiative 0, a 3rd level {@spell Meteor|GuildWars} will impact at the chosen points.
- Bonfaaz Burntfur rallies the charr troops, increasing their morale and improving their abilities. All allied charr gain 10 temporary hit points.
regionalEffects: If the Stormcaller horn has been blown, all charr become vulnerable to all damage, and deal only half damage.

entries.name: Age
entries: Norn can have long lives, living up to 120 and maintaining their good health and vitality for a long time, though very few die of old age.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid. You are also considered a shapeshifter for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be a shapeshifter.

entries.name: Size
entries: Norn are around 9 feet tall and have broad builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

entries.name: Cold Climate Adaptation
entries: You have resistance to cold damage and can't be slowed down or hindered by snowy or icy terrain.

entries.name: Become your Totem
entries: Once per Long Rest you can choose to transform into your Totem animal as an action. When transforming choose an Animal with a CR of 1 ⁄ 4 your Level or lower from the list of available totem animals for your Sub-Race.
Wild Shape rules apply.

entries: When rolling initiative you can add your Intelligence ability modifier in addition to your Dexterity ability modifier to it.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans are around 5 1/2 feet tall and have a wide variety of builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Favoured by the Gods
entries: When choosing this race choose a patron god. The patron god gives you a small amount of power in the form a cantrip, a spell and a resistance to a specific damage type. Your spellcasting ability for those spells is dependent on the god. You can cast the spell once per short rest.

Damage Resistance: Radiant

entries.name: Trained Actor
entries: You can add a d4 to any Charisma (Performance) or Charisma (Deception) ability check.

You can also try to pretend to be dead if you make death saving throws. To do so you must win a contested Charisma (Performance) or Charisma (Deception) ability check against an enemy's Wisdom (Insight) ability check that tries to target you with an attack. If you succeed, that enemy thinks you are dead and does not target you with an attack. If they succeed they see though your deception and can attack normally.

entries.name: Age
entries: Charr reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: Charr are around 7 feet tall and have a wide build. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Cat's Talent
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

entries.name: Military Training
entries: You have proficiency with all simple and non-two-handed martial weapons.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of grey.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength/Dexterity modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries: Charr are around 7 feet tall and have a wide build. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Cat's Talent
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

entries.name: Military Training
entries: You have proficiency with all simple and non-two-handed martial weapons.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of grey.

entries.name: Cat's Claws
entries: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength/Dexterity modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Infernal Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Lava Arrows|GuildWars} cantrip.
Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Flare|GuildWars} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell Fireball (Guild Wars)|GuildWars} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 7th level, you can also cast the {@spell Meteor|GuildWars} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 9th level, you can also cast the {@spell Phoenix|GuildWars} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 11th level, you can also cast the {@spell Meteor Shower|GuildWars} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
Once you reach 13th level, you can also cast the {@spell Rodgort's Invocation|GuildWars} spell with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest.
You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma can be the spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with all simple weapons and the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item Smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.
